laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial count of 0% of total WBC count. Increased to 6% (upper limit of normal) on day 6 of hospitalization and peaked at 1.2 × 10^9/liter (16% of total WBC count) at a dose of 150 mg/day approximately 1 week later.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Eosinophil counts increased gradually and reached a peak at week 4 with 1.2 × 10^9/liter. The count then decreased, remaining within normal limits at the time of discharge.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Total WBC count was 6.9 × 10^9/liter with 0% eosinophils at initial assessment in the emergency department.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Total WBC and absolute neutrophil counts remained normal following multiple blood draws during the hospitalization.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevated to 115 U/liter before returning to normal.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially elevated but normalized and remained within normal limits thereafter.
